result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lael C Bivins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lael C Bivins appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 

Defendant appears Pro Se.  Defendant ordered to the Public Defender's Office to determine eligibility.  Court advised defendant if they do not return to Court, a Bench Warrant would be issued.  

SAME DAY, SAME APPEARANCES.  CASE RECALLED AT THE HOUR 10:09 AM

Defendant returns from Public Defender's Office.  Defendant does qualify for representation.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALB, 2539 North 51st Street, Milwaukee WI.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Lael C Bivins in court. Student Intern Madeline Witte under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
